oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On farm research for quality of maize. Populations evaluation for old and new recipes in France
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lebrun, Remy
Chable, Véronique
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Systems research and participatory research
Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Participatory research in South of France aimed to create and exploit diversity on maize. Farmers and researchers have organized an on-farm experiment with traditional and new populations to assess key quality parameters. Population characteristics were evaluated through the different steps of food processes. Chef and cookers have also proposed new recipes to better exploit the diversity.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lebrun, Remy and Chable, Véronique (2014) On farm research for quality of maize. Populations evaluation for old and new recipes in France. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
